comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: Not only are the houses just a memory - so is the street. Campbell St with its quaint cottages, and some adjacent streets, were resumed by the City Council in the 1920s to 'sanitise / modernise' Surry Hills. See map of resumptions here: www.cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au/history/sydneystreets/Lost_St...

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Sydney must have changed incredibly during that period, the resumptions at the southern end being overtaken by the resumptions at the northern end caused by the building of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. And below the city the construction of the city railway.

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content:
The 1920s and the 1950s/60s were the big development periods for Sydney ( or destructive - depending on your viewpoint) with so many Victorian and Georgian gems razed.
I love the whitewashed fence with paint spatter all over the ground!
